ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL=SAS-label ] 
      
Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the
SAS catalog or external file reference.

[Syntax: NAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file
reference.

[Syntax: REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | SAS-file-reference ] 
      
Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model
specification.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: AUTOREG <options> ; 
      
The AUTOREG statement specifies an autoregressive component of the model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST=RHO | NOEST=VARIANCE | NOEST=( RHO VARIANCE )] 
      
Fixes the values to those specified in RHO= and VARIANCE= options.

[Syntax: RHO=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the damping factor  during the parameter
estimation process.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance during the parameter
estimation process.

[Syntax: BLOCKSIZE=integer ] 
      
Specifies the block size, m.

[Syntax: NBLOCKS=integer ] 
      
Specifies the number of blocks, k.

[Syntax: NOEST ] 
      
Fixes the value of the disturbance variance parameter to the value specified in
the VARIANCE= option.

[Syntax: OFFSET=integer ] 
      
Specifies the position of the first measurement within the block, if the first
measurement is not at the start of a block.

[Syntax: TYPE=DUMMY | TRIG ] 
      
Specifies the type of the seasonal component. The default type is DUMMY.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the
start of the parameter estimation process.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CYCLE <options> ; 
      
The CYCLE statement is used to specify a cycle component in the model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST=PERIOD | RHO | VARIANCE | ( <RHO> <PERIOD> <VARIANCE> ) ] 
      
Fixes the values of the component parameters to those specified in the RHO=,
PERIOD=, and VARIANCE= options.

[Syntax: PERIOD=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the cycle period during the parameter estimation
process. Period value must be strictly larger than 2.

[Syntax: RHO=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the damping factor in this component during the
parameter estimation process. Any value in the interval (0, 1), including one
but excluding zero, is an acceptable initial value for the damping factor.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ] 
      
Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance parameter  to be used
during the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero,
is an acceptable starting value.

Syntax: LAGS=order 
        LAGS=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) 
        LAGS=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> 
      
Defines a model with specified lags. This is a required option in this
statement.

[Syntax: NOEST ] 
      
Fixes the values of the parameters to those specified in PHI= options.

[Syntax: PHI=value ... ] 
      
Lists starting values for the coefficients of the lagged forecast variable.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FORECAST options ; 
      
The FORECAST statement specifies the symbolic name that represents the series
to be forecast and also specifies an optional transformation to be applied to
the series. The symbolic name is used in later steps to associate actual time
series variables with the model specification when the specification is applied
to data.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: (SYMBOL|VAR)= variable ]

Specifies a symbolic name for the forecast series. This symbol specification is
optional. If the SYMBOL= option is not specified, Y is used as a default
symbol.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM= option ] 
      
Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INPUT options ; 
      
The INPUT statements specify the inputs in the model. A separate INPUT
statement is needed for each of the inputs. In this statement you can specify
the delay order, the differencing orders, and the Box-Cox type transformations
associated with the input variable under consideration.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DELAY=order ]

Specifies the delay (or lag) order for the input series.

[Syntax: DIF=order | ( order1, order2, ...) ]

Specifies the differencing orders for the input series.

[Syntax: PREDEFINED=option ] 
      
Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this
transfer function.

[Syntax: (SYMBOL|VAR)=variable ] 
      
Specifies a symbolic name for the input series. This symbol specification is
optional.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM=option ] 
      
Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this
transfer function.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST ]

Fixes the value to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ]

Supplies an initial value for  during the parameter estimation process. Any
nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LEVEL <options> ; 
      
The LEVEL statement is used to include a level component in the model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST ]

Fixes the value to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ]

Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the
start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including
zero, is an acceptable starting value.

[Syntax: LENGTH=integer ]

This option is used to specify the season length s.

[Syntax: NOEST ]

Fixes the value of the disturbance variance parameter to the value specified in
the VARIANCE= option.

[Syntax: TYPE=DUMMY | TRIG ]

Specifies the type of the seasonal component. The default type is DUMMY.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ]

Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the
start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including
zero, is an acceptable starting value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LEVEL <options> ; 
      
The SLOPE statement is used to include a slope component in the model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST ]

Fixes the value of the disturbance variance  to the value specified in the
VARIANCE= option.

[Syntax: VARIANCE=value ]

Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the
start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including
zero, is an acceptable starting value.
